refnamediv.refpurpose: Transfers data from immediate pfields into a function table.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This subroutine transfers data from immediate pfields into a function table.

refsect1.title: Syntax
refsect1.synopsis: f # time size 2 v1 v2 v3 ...

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: size -- number of points in the table. Must be a power of 2 or a power-of-2 plus 1 (see f statement). The maximum tablesize is 16777216 (224) points.

v1, v2, v3, etc. -- values to be copied directly into the table space. The number of values is limited by the compile-time variable PMAX, which controls the maximum pfields (currently 1000). The values copied may include the table guard point; any table locations not filled will contain zeros.

note.title: Note
note.para: If p4 (the GEN routine number is positive, the table will be post-normalized (rescaled to a maximum absolute value of 1 after generation). A negative p4 will cause rescaling to be skipped. You will usually want to use -2 with this GEN function, so that your values are not normalized.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para:
Here is an example of the GEN02 routine. It uses the files gen02.csd.
Example of the GEN02 routine.
See the sections Real-time Audio and Command Line Flags for more information on using command line flags.
These are the diagrams of the waveforms of the GEN02 routines, as used in the example:
f 2 0 5 2 0 2 0
f 2 0 5 2 0 2 0
f 3 0 5 2 0 2 10 0
f 3 0 5 2 0 2 10 0
f 4 0 9 2 0 2 10 100 0
f 4 0 9 2 0 2 10 100 0

refsect1.title: Credits
refsect1.para: December 2002. Thanks to Rasmus Ekman, corrected the limit of the PMAX variable.
